ProductReviews.ProductReviews.name: ProductReviews
ProductReviews.ProductReviews.text: Defines the ProductReviews module (Model, Collection, Views, Router) Mount to App also handles rendering of the reviews if the current view has any placeholder for them

getReviewParams.name: getReviewParams
getReviewParams.text: parse url options and return product reviews api params

children.name: application
children.theRestString: @param {Object} options url parameters @return {Object} the reviews params

core.ApplicationSkeleton.name: ApplicationSkeleton
core.ApplicationSkeleton.text: extends BackboneEvents Defines the top level components of an application like the name, layout, or the start function

module.text: bla bla bla del core copy&paste

resizeImage.name: resizeImage
resizeImage.text: Wraps the SC.Utils.resizeImage and passes in the settings it needs

getConfig.name: getConfig
getConfig.text: returns the configuration object of the aplication if a path is applied, it returns that attribute of the config if nothing is found, it returns the default value

getUserPromise.name: getUserPromise
getUserPromise.text: Because the application MAY load the user's profile asynchronous some modules may want to register when the profile is ready to be used application.getUser(). Note: from views is OK to call getUser() directly, but for mountToApp(), please call getUserPromise() first! the profile itself it is responsible of resolving the SC.PROFILE_PROMISE global promise (like in sc.user.environment.ssp)

children.name: BackboneView
children.text: This View will be created and added to the dom as soon as the app starts. All module's views will get into the dom through this view by calling either showContent, showInModal, showError or other application specific method

module.name: core
module.text: bla bla bla del core copy&paste

content_element.name: content_element
content_element.text: where the content (views) will be apended

updateUI.name: updateUI
updateUI.text: update the internal dom references (this.key_elements) . Since this method (should) is called when important markup is updated/added dynamically it is wrapped by those modules who need to enrich the content like the Content Delivery module.

appendToDom.name: appendToDom
appendToDom.text: appends this layout root element into the DOM, defined in this.container_element

touchpointPost.name: touchpointPost
touchpointPost.text: perform a POST operation to the specified touchpoint ('post-touchpoint')

core.Utils.name: Utils
core.Utils.text: A collection of utility methods This are added to both SC.Utils, and Underscore.js eg: you could use SC.Utils.formatPhone() or _.formatPhone()

formatPhone.name: formatPhone
formatPhone.text: Will try to reformat a phone number for a given phone Format, If no format is given, it will try to use the one in site settings.

html.HTMLElement.name: HTMLElement
html.HTMLElement.text: ApplicationSkeleton.Layout.showContent.js ----------------------------------------- Renders a View into the layout if the view needs to be rendered in a modal, it does so triggers a few different events on the layout
